title: Drastic FPS Drop throughout the game (New)
body:
About two weeks ago I notice I was getting massive FPS during my league games.  This FPS would increase as the game went on.

Specs: (I know its not a beast, but it used to run this game well)
Windows 10
I5 2500k @3.3 GHZ
Nvidia Geforce 760
14GB Ram

Start each game at ~280 FPS
Meet opponent in lane ~160 FPS
Mid Game ~120 FPS
Late Game ~ 80 FPS
*roughly 200 FPS drop throughout game*

I used to start the game at ~300 FPS and play all game around 180.

Things I have tried/tested.

1. Disable Xbox DVR
2. Check GPU temp -never exceeds 70 degrees- No hot air felt
3. Clean install of Nvidia drivers.  Tried the last 3 drivers all clean install, all the same issue.
4. Clean install of League of Legends (Also tried repair prior)
5. Clean registry with CCleaner
6. Run Malwarebytes - No infections, Run Anti-virus-No infections
7. Windows up to date
8. Tested War Thunder - Not experiencing FPS drop during the game

Things of note:
1. I don't know if its helpful, but about 3 weeks ago my pvp.net kernel stopped working, I can only run the game as admin.  I have used the "permissions" guide, has not changed anything.
2. Game loads properly as administrator, but I never used to have to do this.

Really at my wits end.  To me I thought for sure it would be the GPU overheating... but I test it with CAM and as I got the drops my temps never exceeded 70 degrees, which should be in the safe range.

Read all the guides, all the suggestions.  Simply nothing has worked for me.  Please help... anyone.

replies.body:
CAM has actually caused issues in the past with League, so I recommend disabling it, then ensuring you've checked up on your [Windows power settings](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting#wq6). I'd also recommend capping your FPS to match the refresh rate of your display, as uncapped frames can cause inconsistencies in your FPS and *screen tearing*. 

Let me know if those steps caused any change.

I have uninstalled CAM, did not seem to have any change.

Worked with the windows power settings, no apparent change.

I used to run this game at 144 FPS capped and it never dropped below there.  Now by mid game I am fairly consistently under FPS cap.

Thanks for the advice, frustrating that I am unable to solve this.  It just happened one day out of no where and I guess now I am stuck with it.

I'm confident we can resolve this if you reach out to our tech team. Run a set of system logs using our [Hextech Tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367), then attach them to a [support ticket request](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).

Let me know if you have any issues with those steps.
